alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 03 at 1:48PM PDT until April 04 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM PDT TUESDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 1500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...Central Douglas County, Eastern Douglas County Foothills and Jackson County. This includes Butte Falls, Prospect, Toketee Falls, and Highway 227 between Tiller and Trail. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 11 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels at around 2000 to 2500 feet early this evening will fall to around 1000 feet overnight then rise to 2500 to 3000 feet during Tuesday. Elevations between 1000 and 1500 feet may see up to an inch of snow early Tuesday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County
